title: Snow Crash Popularizes the Term 'Metaverse'
overview: Neal Stephenson publishes the novel *Snow Crash*, introducing the word 'Metaverse' to describe a persistent virtual world — inspiring future VR and XR visions.

title: Second Life Launches
overview: Linden Lab launches Second Life, one of the first large-scale persistent virtual worlds, with a thriving economy and millions of users.

title: Oculus VR Founded
overview: Oculus VR is founded, later acquired by Facebook. Its Rift headset revives interest in consumer-grade virtual reality hardware.

title: Google Glass Released
overview: Google introduces Google Glass, an early attempt at augmented reality smart glasses, sparking debate about wearables and privacy.

title: Pokémon GO Popularizes AR
overview: Niantic launches Pokémon GO, blending augmented reality with geolocation, reaching massive mainstream adoption worldwide.

title: HTC Vive Launch
overview: HTC and Valve release the Vive, a VR headset with room-scale tracking, setting new standards for immersive gaming and applications.

title: Facebook Horizon / Horizon Worlds
overview: Facebook (later Meta) launches Horizon Worlds, a social VR platform central to its vision of building the Metaverse.

title: Facebook Rebrands as Meta
overview: Facebook rebrands as Meta, signaling its ambition to lead in building the Metaverse and investing heavily in XR technologies.

title: Apple AR/VR Rumors Intensify
overview: Reports and patents fuel speculation around Apple’s upcoming AR/VR headset, highlighting Big Tech’s interest in XR ecosystems.

title: Apple Vision Pro Announced
overview: Apple unveils Vision Pro, its first spatial computing headset, redefining mixed reality experiences with advanced optics and eye/hand tracking.
